description: Strand units: Counting and Numeration, Comparing and ordering, Place value, and Operation (Addition, Subtraction).

teaching.topicContent: In two-digit numbers, the ones place represents the value of the units, the tens place represents the value of the groups of ten, and the hundreds place represents the value of the groups of hundred. We will practice identifying the ones, tens and sometimes the hundreds place in different two-digit and three-digit numbers  and learn how to name them.
Addition is the process of combining two or more numbers to find the total. We will learn strategies that will aid addition and subtraction.

teaching.topicTitle: Addition of Two and three-Digit Numbers without Regrouping
teaching.topicContent: Addition of two-digit numbers without regrouping is the process of adding two-digit numbers where there is no need to regroup or carry over. We will learn the symbols and vocabulary associated with addition and practice adding two-digit numbers without regrouping.

teaching.topicTitle: Adding Two and three-Digit Numbers with Regrouping
teaching.topicContent: We will practice adding two-digit numbers with regrouping using different methods such as place value charts and number lines. We will learn how to align the numbers, add the ones place and the tens place separately, and regroup the tens place if necessary. We will also practice checking our work by adding the numbers vertically and horizontally to make sure they match.
Subtracting involves understanding place value and borrowing. Start by using Addition facts to help you.
Mastering subtraction boosts confidence and creates a foundation for other operations.

Regrouping (borrowing) is vital for 1 to 200 subtraction. Recognize borrowing situations, perform the borrowing process, and practice consistently. Mastering regrouping boosts confidence in subtraction.

test.description: Put your Number strand knowledge to the test.
